title: Giant Helvetica
content:
I was at the Oregon Coast this summer and took a picture that I thought might interest, or at least temporarily entertain, some of you.   
According to the [Tillamook Air Museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014160535/http:/www.tillamookair.com/), these letters are 100 feet tall (30.48 meters). Is this the largest Helvetica in the world? What would the point size be?   
   
   
 ![Giant Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014160535im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/49587.jpg)
author: Isaac

comments.content: Ha... measuring my Linotype Helvetica PDF, the 96 point characters have a cap height of .953" (approx.); therefor, my quick calculations indicate that type whose cap height is 100 feet (1,200 inches) would be equivalent to type whose nominal measure is 120,881 points... yeah, pretty large type.
